--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:

> 
> 2) Phased searching - The current plan then is to implement 
the 'phased 
> search' technique discussed on this groups a while ago, and to see 
if it 
> is able evolve better players. Before I do this though I want to 
> implement a more simple problem domain, one that is fast to 
evaluate so 
> that experiments can be run a lot faster....
> 

I look forward to seeing how this goes.  It would be interesting to 
compare it to the "mixed" search of Derek and Philip.

> 
> 3)OCR - Optical Character Recognition. The plan is to expose a set 
of 2D 
> bitmaps, in turn, to the inputs of an NN. The number of outputs 
will 
> reflect the number of 2D maps in the current set, so that the NN 
can 
> indicate which character it 'thinks' it is looking at by setting 
the 
> appropriate output high. Straightforward and hopefully very fast. 
Also 
> the problem difficulty can be adjusted by changing the set size, 
the 
> data in the sets and the dimensions of each character.  Using such 
a 
> scheme allows us to very rapidly increase the input/output space - 
which 
> we know is going to cause NEAT difficulties. I can then experiment 
on 
> this domain with phased searching switched on to see if it 
improves the 
> NNs we can generate.
> 

It might be easier to evolve a single classifier net for each 
character, i.e. "is it or isn't it an 'a'?"  That obviously reduces 
the output space a lot.  Then you could combine all these separate 
networks into a single network and let NEAT evolve interconnections 
to improve how they interact with each other...just an idea!

ken
